intro: Psychotria russellii, commonly known as Russell's psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptic leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often consumed by birds and other wildlife. Due to its habitat preferences and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
